Interface ClientView

All Known Implementing Classes:
ClientCLIView, ClientGuiController, ClientGUIView
public interface ClientView

  • Method Details

    • getClientController

      ClientController getClientController()
      Retrieves the instance of the ClientController associated with this view.
      Returns:
      the ClientController instance managing the client-side logic

    • initialize

      void initialize()
      Initializes the client view component by setting up input handling mechanisms. This method starts background threads responsible for reading user input and processing it into appropriate actions via input queues and handlers. The method ensures smooth interaction between the client view and the input processing system by continuously monitoring user inputs while running in daemon threads, allowing proper thread termination when the main thread concludes.

    • askForInput

      String askForInput(String questionDescription, String interrogationPrompt)
      Prompts the user with a question or description and displays an interrogation prompt to gather an input from the user.
      Parameters:
      questionDescription - a brief description or context for the question being asked
      interrogationPrompt - the specific prompt intended to request input from the user
      Returns:
      the string representation of the user's input

    • showMessage

      void showMessage(String message, MessageType type)
      Displays a message to the user with a specific message type.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to be displayed to the user
      type - the type of the message, specifying how it should be handled or displayed

    • showError

      void showError(String errorMessage)
      Displays an error message to the user.
      Parameters:
      errorMessage - the error message to be displayed

    • askNickname

      void askNickname()
      Prompts the user to input their nickname. This method is typically used at the beginning of the client interaction to collect the player's preferred username. It may include an interface for user input and handle the process of storing or validating the provided nickname.

    • showMainMenu

      void showMainMenu()
      Displays the main menu of the client interface to the user. Provides access to various options and features available within the application. Typically invoked after the user successfully registers or needs to navigate the primary options.

    • notifyPlayerJoined

      void notifyPlayerJoined(String nickname, GameInfo gameInfo)
      Notifies the client that a player has joined a game.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player who joined.
      gameInfo - Information about the game that the player has joined.

    • notifyGameCreated

      void notifyGameCreated(String gameId)
      Notifies the client that a game has been successfully created.
      Parameters:
      gameId - the unique identifier of the created game

    • notifyGameStarted

      void notifyGameStarted(GameState gameState)
      Notifies the client that the game has started and provides the current game state.
      Parameters:
      gameState - the current state of the game

    • intToPlayerColor

      default PlayerColor intToPlayerColor(int colorChoice)
      Converts an integer value to a corresponding PlayerColor enum value. If the integer does not match any predefined color, the default color RED is returned.
      Parameters:
      colorChoice - the integer value representing the desired PlayerColor
      Returns:
      the PlayerColor corresponding to the provided integer value, or RED if the value does not match any available PlayerColor

    • showNewGameState

      void showNewGameState()
      Displays the updated state of the game to the user. This method should be called when the game state has changed, ensuring that the user interface reflects the latest game conditions and provides the necessary information for the next steps.

    • showNewCardState

      void showNewCardState()
      Updates the user interface to reflect the current state of the card in the game. This method is typically invoked after the card state has been updated in the model. It ensures that any relevant details regarding the new card state are visually or contextually presented to the user in the application's view.

    • showCurrAdventureCard

      void showCurrAdventureCard(boolean isFirstTime)
      Displays the current adventure card to the user.
      Parameters:
      isFirstTime - a boolean indicating whether this is the first time displaying the adventure card.

    • getClientModel

      ClientModel getClientModel()
      Retrieves the ClientModel associated with this instance. The ClientModel represents the current state and data of the client that interacts with the application.
      Returns:
      the ClientModel instance tied to this instance of the client view

    • showBuildShipBoardMenu

      void showBuildShipBoardMenu()
      Displays the menu for building a ship board during the game setup process. This method is intended to interact with the player, allowing them to select ship components, configure their ship, and prepare for subsequent phases of the game.

    • showPickedComponentAndMenu

      void showPickedComponentAndMenu()
      Displays the selected component along with a menu for the user. This method is used to provide a visual and interactive context after a component has been selected, enabling the user to take appropriate actions or make further choices.

    • showShipBoard

      void showShipBoard(ShipBoardClient shipBoard, String shipBoardOwnerNickname)
      Displays the ship board of a specific player along with the owner's nickname.
      Parameters:
      shipBoard - the ship board to be displayed
      shipBoardOwnerNickname - the nickname of the ship board's owner

    • showShipBoard

      void showShipBoard(ShipBoardClient shipBoardClient, String shipBoardOwnerNickname, Map<String,Set<Coordinates>> colorMap)
      Displays the ship board along with additional customization and color mapping for the components.
      Parameters:
      shipBoardClient - the ship board to be displayed, which contains the state of the ship including its components
      shipBoardOwnerNickname - the nickname of the player who owns the displayed ship board
      colorMap - a map where each key corresponds to a color identifier, and each value is a set of coordinates indicating the positions of components or sections of the ship board associated with that color

    • showVisibleComponentAndMenu

      void showVisibleComponentAndMenu(Map<Integer,Component> visibleComponents)
      Displays the provided visible components along with the relevant menu.
      Parameters:
      visibleComponents - a map containing the components to be displayed, where the key represents an integer identifier for each component, and the value is the corresponding Component object

    • showLittleDeck

      void showLittleDeck(int littleDeckChoice)
      Displays the specified little deck based on the given choice.
      Parameters:
      littleDeckChoice - an integer representing the choice of the little deck to display.

    • updateTimeLeft

      void updateTimeLeft(int timeLeft, int flipsLeft)
      Updates the remaining time and the number of flips left for the client view.
      Parameters:
      timeLeft - the amount of time remaining in seconds
      flipsLeft - the number of flips remaining

    • notifyTimerEnded

      void notifyTimerEnded(int flipsLeft)
      Notifies the client that the hourglass timer has ended. This method is typically called when the timer reaches zero.
      Parameters:
      flipsLeft - the number of flips remaining for the hourglass timer

    • notifyHourglassStarted

      void notifyHourglassStarted(int flipsLeft, String nickname)
      Notifies the client view that the hourglass timer has started. Provides information about the remaining flips and the nickname of the player associated with the hourglass.
      Parameters:
      flipsLeft - the number of flips remaining for the hourglass
      nickname - the nickname of the player associated with the hourglass timer

    • showWaitingForPlayers

      void showWaitingForPlayers()
      Displays a message or interface indicating that the game is currently waiting for players to join. This method is typically called while transitioning between game states, ensuring the user is informed of the current status and expected action.

    • showPickReservedComponentQuestion

      void showPickReservedComponentQuestion()
      Displays a prompt to the user to choose a reserved component. This method will present the necessary information to the user and allow them to make a selection related to their reserved components.

    • showInvalidShipBoardMenu

      void showInvalidShipBoardMenu()
      Displays a menu indicating that the ship board configuration is invalid. This method typically provides the user with options to address or correct the issues with the ship board setup, such as repositioning components or reviewing improperly placed elements.

    • showValidShipBoardMenu

      void showValidShipBoardMenu()
      Displays the valid ship board menu to the user. This method is typically invoked to allow the user to interact with a ship board that has passed validation or does not contain any errors. The implementation of this menu provides options related to further actions or configurations the player can take regarding their validated ship board.

    • showChooseComponentToRemoveMenu

      void showChooseComponentToRemoveMenu()
      Displays a menu for the user to select which component they would like to remove from their shipboard. This is typically used in scenarios where a player's shipboard contains components that are incorrectly positioned or invalid within the game's rules. The method transitions the user interface to provide relevant options for removal, enabling players to correct their shipboard setup.

    • showChooseShipPartsMenu

      void showChooseShipPartsMenu(List<Set<Coordinates>> shipParts)
      Displays a menu where the user can choose ship parts. The provided list represents different sets of ship parts, where each set contains coordinates of components that form a part of the ship.
      Parameters:
      shipParts - a list of sets, where each set contains the coordinates of components belonging to a specific ship part.

    • showVisitLocationMenu

      void showVisitLocationMenu()
      Displays the menu for visiting a location during the game. This method is typically invoked when the game state changes to a point where the player needs to choose or interact with a specific location. This menu provides the available options related to visiting locations and allows the user to make their selection accordingly.

    • showThrowDicesMenu

      void showThrowDicesMenu()
      Displays the menu for rolling dice during a specific game phase. This method is typically used when the player needs to perform an action requiring a dice roll, such as determining outcomes tied to randomness. It provides the user with the necessary options to proceed with the dice roll.

    • showChoosePlanetMenu

      void showChoosePlanetMenu()
      Displays the menu to allow the player to choose a planet to visit. This method is typically invoked during the selection phase in the game where the player is required to select a planet for their next move.

    • showChooseEnginesMenu

      void showChooseEnginesMenu()
      Displays the menu for choosing available engines in the current game context. This method is typically invoked when the game logic requires the player to select engines, such as during configuration or gameplay events where engines are relevant. The menu will present options to the player based on the current state of the game and available resources.

    • showAcceptTheRewardMenu

      void showAcceptTheRewardMenu()
      Displays the menu for accepting a reward in the game. This method is invoked when the game's state transitions to the context of handling reward acceptance. It provides the user with the appropriate interface or prompts required to accept a reward. The specific details of the reward and interaction are managed within the respective implementation.

    • showChooseCannonsMenu

      void showChooseCannonsMenu()
      Displays the menu for choosing cannons in the game's interface. This method is used when the player is required to interact with the game and make a decision related to available cannon options. It is typically called during a specific state in the game where a cannon-related choice is needed, and it updates the interface to reflect the options available to the player.

    • showSmallDanObjMenu

      void showSmallDanObjMenu()
      Displays the menu for handling small dangerous objects within the game. This method is part of the graphical user interface and is invoked when the player needs to address situations involving small hazards or risky objects.

    • showBigMeteoriteMenu

      void showBigMeteoriteMenu()
      Displays the menu related to handling a big meteorite event in the game. This menu provides options or prompts for the user to respond to or manage the effects of encountering a big meteorite during gameplay.

    • showBigShotMenu

      void showBigShotMenu()
      Displays the menu for handling a "Big Shot" event during the game. A "Big Shot" scenario typically involves a significant game event or challenge where players need to make decisions related to this event. The method is invoked when the game state transitions to the "Big Shot" handling phase.

    • showHandleRemoveCrewMembersMenu

      void showHandleRemoveCrewMembersMenu()
      Displays the menu for handling the removal of crew members. This menu allows the user to make decisions regarding crew members that may need to be removed under specific game conditions. Typically invoked in scenarios where an evaluation of crew members is required due to gameplay events, such as attacks or status changes.

    • showHandleCubesRewardMenu

      void showHandleCubesRewardMenu()
      Displays the menu for handling a cubes reward scenario during the game. This menu allows the player to interact with the game mechanics related to processing or managing rewards involving cubes. Typically invoked when the game state transitions to a phase where such rewards need to be addressed.

    • showEpidemicMenu

      void showEpidemicMenu()
      Displays the epidemic menu to the user. This menu is intended to handle scenarios where epidemic-related gameplay actions are required. The method is typically used in scenarios where the game state transitions to an epidemic-related event, requiring the user to make decisions or take specific actions related to managing an epidemic within the game.

    • showStardustMenu

      void showStardustMenu()
      Displays the Stardust Menu in the client view. This menu is used to handle interactions or options related to stardust within the game environment. The context in which this menu is shown depends on the current state of the game and the player's actions.

    • showHandleCubesMalusMenu

      void showHandleCubesMalusMenu()
      Displays the menu for handling cube maluses during gameplay. This method is responsible for presenting options or information related to cube penalties that might be applied to the player's game state at this specific point of interaction.

    • checkShipBoardAfterAttackMenu

      void checkShipBoardAfterAttackMenu()
      Displays the menu to inspect the player's shipboard after an attack has occurred. This method is triggered during post-attack scenarios to allow players to assess the state of their shipboard and make necessary decisions based on damages or other outcomes resulting from the attack.

    • showCrewMembersInfo

      void showCrewMembersInfo()
      Displays the currently available information regarding the crew members on the ship. This method is responsible for presenting details such as crew status, positions, and any relevant updates about crew members to the user.

    • showFirstToEnter

      void showFirstToEnter()
      Displays a message or visual indicator to notify the user about the first player who has entered or performed a specific action. This method is typically called to inform or highlight the first participant in a significant game-related event or action.

    • setIsTestFlight

      void setIsTestFlight(boolean isTestFlight)
      Sets the test flight mode for the client view.
      Parameters:
      isTestFlight - a boolean value indicating whether the test flight mode is enabled (true) or disabled (false)

    • showCurrentRanking

      void showCurrentRanking()
      Displays the current ranking of players. This method is responsible for rendering the current ranking information to the user, typically reflecting the latest updates in players' standings. The ranking is updated based on game events and player actions.

    • showCrewPlacementMenu

      void showCrewPlacementMenu()
      Displays the crew placement menu to the user. This method is typically invoked during the crew placement phase of the game. It allows the user to interact with and make decisions regarding crew placement on the ship.

    • showPrefabShipsMenu

      void showPrefabShipsMenu(List<PrefabShipInfo> prefabShips)
      Displays a menu of available prefab ships to the user.
      Parameters:
      prefabShips - the list of PrefabShipInfo objects containing information about the prefab ships

    • showComponentHitInfo

      void showComponentHitInfo(Coordinates coordinates)
      Displays information about a component hit at the given coordinates on the shipboard.
      Parameters:
      coordinates - the coordinates of the component that was hit

    • cardStateToClientState

      default ClientState cardStateToClientState(CardState cardState, ClientModel clientModel)
      Converts the given card state to a corresponding client state based on the game logic. The method determines the client-side representation of the given card state, taking into account additional context provided by the client model.
      Parameters:
      cardState - the current card state to be translated into a client state
      clientModel - the client model providing additional context for the state conversion
      Returns:
      the corresponding client state derived from the given card state and client model

    • showCardStateMenu

      default void showCardStateMenu(ClientState mappedState)
      Displays the appropriate menu based on the given client state. This method maps a specific ClientState to its corresponding menu and executes the related functionality.
      Parameters:
      mappedState - the current client state that determines which menu to show

    • showInfectedCrewMembersRemoved

      void showInfectedCrewMembersRemoved(Set<Coordinates> cabinWithNeighbors)
      Displays information about the cabins and their neighboring components where infected crew members have been removed.
      Parameters:
      cabinWithNeighbors - a set of coordinates representing the cabins and their adjacent areas affected by the removal of infected crew members

    • showEndGameInfo

      void showEndGameInfo(List<PlayerFinalData> finalRanking, List<String> playersNicknamesWithPrettiestShip)
      Displays the end-game information including the final ranking of players and the nicknames of players with the prettiest ship.
      Parameters:
      finalRanking - the final ranking of players represented as a list of PlayerFinalData objects
      playersNicknamesWithPrettiestShip - a list of nicknames of players who have the prettiest ship

    • showPlayerEarlyLanded

      void showPlayerEarlyLanded(String nickname)
      Displays a notification or message indicating that a player has landed early.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player who landed early

    • showCubes

      void showCubes(ShipBoardClient shipboardOf, String nickname)
      Displays the cubes associated with a specific player's shipboard.
      Parameters:
      shipboardOf - the shipboard client representing the player's current state
      nickname - the nickname of the player whose cubes are being displayed

    • refreshGameInfos

      void refreshGameInfos(List<GameInfo> gameInfos)
      Updates the current game information displayed to the client.
      Parameters:
      gameInfos - a list of GameInfo objects containing the updated game information

    • showDisconnectMessage

      void showDisconnectMessage(String message)
      Displays a disconnect message to the user.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to be shown indicating the disconnect status

    • showNoMoreHiddenComponents

      void showNoMoreHiddenComponents()
      Displays all components that are hidden, making them visible again. This method ensures that any previously hidden UI components or elements are revealed and visible to the user. It does not alter the state of components that are already visible and does not perform any additional operations on other components. This method is typically used to restore full visibility within the user interface.

    • showCubeRedistributionMenu

      void showCubeRedistributionMenu()
      Displays the cube redistribution menu in the application. This method is responsible for presenting the user interface or options related to redistributing cubes. It may involve interaction with the user to select or confirm redistribution choices.

    • showStolenVisibleComponent

      void showStolenVisibleComponent()

    • notifyPlayerDisconnected

      void notifyPlayerDisconnected(String disconnectedPlayerNickname)
